alert.note: Alert for Neshoba (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 15 at 8:57PM CDT until March 19 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Mississippi... Pearl River Near Carthage affecting Leake County. Pearl River Above Philadelphia affecting Neshoba County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON TO SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pearl River Above Philadelphia. * WHEN...From Wednesday afternoon to Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Water begins to affect Burnside Lake Water Park. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 12.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 13.5 feet early Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Pearl River Philadelphi 13.0 12.1 Tue 7 pm CDT 13.2 13.5 13.2 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Forecast includes rainfall on the ground and 24 hours of additional rainfall. Additional information is available at www.water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=JAN The next statement will be issued tomorrow morning by 10 am CDT.
